alert.note: Alert for Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:47AM CDT until June 22 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL BURLEIGH...NORTH CENTRAL MORTON AND SOUTHEASTERN OLIVER COUNTIES... At 347 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Wilton to 12 miles north of Bismarck to near Mandan, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Wilton around 400 AM CDT. Regan around 415 AM CDT. Wing around 425 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Double Ditch Indian Village, Price, Arena, Lake Harmon and Baldwin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
